channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan general says Taliban gains threaten global security
item.description: An Afghan general warns of devastating consequences if the Taliban win their fight against government forces.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Head of Belarus exiles group found dead in Ukraine
item.description: Vitaly Shishov lived in Ukraine and led a group helping people who fled the Belarus crackdown.

item.title: Wuhan: Chinese city to test entire population after virus resurfaces
item.description: The city of 11 million people is known to be the site where the coronavirus first emerged in 2019.

item.title: Matt Damon says he has never personally used gay slur
item.description: The Hollywood star had been criticised for saying he had only recently "retired" the insult.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Sheikh Jarrah: Palestinians reject offer to end evictions threat
item.description: A plan to end a long-running saga which has fuelled Israel-Palestinian tensions is turned down.

item.title: Twitter works with news sites to tackle disinformation
item.description: Twitter announces it will cooperate with two news agencies to promote more reliable information.

item.title: IOC launches investigation into Belarus sprinter case
item.description: Olympian Krystina Timanovskaya says she was almost forced on a plane home after criticising coaches.

item.title: Qantas stands down 2,500 staff over Sydney lockdown
item.description: The airline says it expects Australia's largest city to be closed for at least two more months.

item.title: Official recommends rerun in Amazon union fight
item.description: A National Labor Relations Board official wants another union vote for Amazon workers in Alabama.

item.title: UK and Iran summon diplomats after tanker attack
item.description: Two people were killed in the attack on an oil tanker, which the UK, US and Israel blame on Iran.

item.title: Kathy Griffin: US comedian has surgery after lung cancer diagnosis
item.description: Kathy Griffin is having half of her left lung removed, saying "doctors are very optimistic".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: Covid third wave: Americans 'scared and angry' as pandemic worsens
item.description: As the Delta variant causes a rethink about risk, Americans are battling to keep a feeling of normalcy.

item.title: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: Covid-19: The mystery of rising infections in India's Kerala
item.description: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in Kerala despite the waning of the second wave elsewhere in India.

item.title: Ethiopia: Growing concerns for unity as Tigray conflict spreads
item.description: The nine-month-long conflict in Tigray has spread, with little hope of peace talks taking place soon.

item.title: F1's Esteban Ocon: How it feels winning your first Formula 1 race
item.description: The 24-year-old Frenchman pulled off a huge F1 shock by winning the Hungarian Grand Prix

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals – and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Covid vaccine inequity 'completely unacceptable and unethical'
item.description: Rich countries need to do more to give vaccines to poor countries, says top WHO adviser Helen Clark.

item.title: 'The reason I'm doing this is because I was inspired by him'
item.description: Karim al-Jian was inspired to study medicine, after learning about a doctor who was killed helping civilians in Syria.

item.title: Turkey: People flee popular tourist spots to escape wildfires
item.description: Footage has emerged showing people fleeing the deadly fires which have engulfed parts of Turkey.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Canoeist Lisa Carrington wins two golds, Warholm smashes record, Biles returns
item.description: New Zealand sprint canoeist Lisa Carrington wins two quickfire golds at the Tokyo Olympics, as Norway's Karsten Warholm smashes the 400m hurdles world record.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold in first leg of attempted treble
item.description: Sifan Hassan takes 5,000m gold as she bids for an unprecedented Olympic treble on the track in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Serhiy Kulish eliminated after shooting at rival's target
item.description: Ukraine's Serhiy Kulish gets distracted by a wardrobe malfunction and shoots at his rival's target.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Giles Scott wins Finn class, gold in men's 49er & silver in mixed Nacra 17
item.description: Great Britain win two golds and a silver on a thrilling day in sailing at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

item.title: All you need to know about new climbing event
item.description: Climbing is the last of the new Olympic sports to make its appearance at Tokyo 2020. Here's a guide to the things you need to know.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: USA men's basketball team beat Spain to reach last four
item.description: Defending champions USA beat Spain for the fourth Olympics in a row to reach the men's basketball semi-finals.
